column6: Disclosure Name
column9: Initiative from the undisclosed GRI (found by the coder but not mentioned in the GRI index table)

column6: Approach to stakeholder engagement
column13: MinRes' Continuous Disclosure Policy states that the Managing Director, Executive General Manager Corporate Development and Company Secretary have been appointed as the Company's Disclosure Officers. The Disclosure Officers are responsible for all communication with the ASX Managing Director, Executive General Manager Corporate Development and Company Secretary. They are responsible for deciding what should be disclosed publicly under the Continuous Disclosure Policy.
column20: Continuous Disclosure Policy, Disclosure Officer, ASX Managing Director

column6: Collective bargaining agreements
column7: In 2023, 30% of MinRes' employees were covered by collective agreements.

column6: Process to determine material topics
column13: MinRes conducts a materiality assessment and review to understand its material sustainability topics. In line with best practice, MinRes' materiality assessment applies GRI Principles to determine report content, undertaken annually to identify the most critical sustainability issues influencing its ability to create and maintain value in the short, medium and long term.
column20: Materiality assessment, material sustainability topic, report content

column6: List of material topics
column7: MinRes' material topics are responsible supply chain, climate change, and value and performance.

column6: Management of material topics
column13: During FY23, MinRes conducted an employee engagement survey called Your Voice for the second year to gain insights into what matters most to its people. The Your Voice survey provided benchmark data on workplace culture, allowing MinRes to gather anonymous feedback and review trends and opportunities for improvement. The survey assessed 15 engagement factors, with over 3,100 employees (76 per cent) contributing to the results, which ranks above the industry participation benchmark.
column20: Your Voice, employee engagement survey, workplace culture

column6: Direct economic value generated and distributed
column7: MinRes made AUD 1,512 million in revenues in 2023.

column6: Financial implications and other risks and opportunities due to climate change
column13: The MinRes Climate Change Policy acknowledges its responsibility to address the impact of its operations on the natural environment and to drive action to reduce carbon intensity. The Policy outlines MinRes' commitment to managing its climate-related obligations, risks and opportunities as it operates within an increasingly carbon-constrained and changing climate.
column20: Climate Change Policy, natural environment, carbon intensity

column6: Proportion of senior management hired from the local community
column7: MinRes has one Board member coming from Indigenous Australia.

column6: Infrastructure investments and services supported
column13: MinRes delivered a unique event experience to 14,563 school children and students as a 2023 Resources Technology Showcase partner. The interactive MinRes activation brought to life the lithium world, showcasing how lithium is powering modern technology and future careers and guiding the world's transition to a cleaner energy future.
column20: 2023 Resources Technology Showcase, lithium, future career

column6: Infrastructure investments and services supported
column13: MinRes established an important values-based partnership with Curtin University in addition to MinRes' 2021 pledge to support the Moorditj Yorga Scholarship, which provides four scholarships per year for mature-aged Indigenous Australian women to attend Curtin University and complete a course of their choice.
column20: Moorditj Yorga Scholarship, Curtin University, Indigenous Australian

column6: Significant indirect economic impacts
column13: In FY23, MinRes issued 158 Self-Assessment Questionnaires (SAQs), of which 151 were issued due to MinRes' embedded risk screening and assessment process for high-risk suppliers. Subsequently, 48 suppliers returned an SAQ with a medium-risk rating and, as per MinRes' process, were issued with encouragement notices. Ongoing dialogue with suppliers during the year resulted in 12 suppliers further reducing their SAQ risk rating to low due to demonstrating improvements in processes and procedures addressing human rights risks in their business.
column20: Self-Assessment Questionnaire, risk screening, high-risk supplier

column6: Proportion of spending on local suppliers
column13: The MinRes Indigenous Procurement Strategy commits MinRes and its contracting business partners to promoting, supporting, and employing local Indigenous Australians. MinRes has worked with Traditional Owners to identify Indigenous businesses that would benefit from an Indigenous Small Business Grant. The funding supports the set-up costs of a new business, including registration, business advice, legal structure and basic training.
column20: Indigenous Procurement Strategy, business partner, Traditional Owner

column6: Operations assessed for risks related to corruption
column13: MinRes' Anti-Bribery and Corruption Policy outlines its expectations in not tolerating bribery, corruption, or any actions that constitute fraud. It encourages employees to speak up and report concerns internally and externally, including through its external whistleblower hotline, MinRes Integrity Assist.
column20: Anti-Bribery and Corruption Policy, bribery, corruption, fraud

column6: Communication and training about anti-corruption policies and procedures
column13: Before commencing employment with MinRes, all employees must complete training on the Code of Conduct and undertake refresher training each year to understand their requirements. During FY23, MinRes updated its refresher e-learning package on the Code. It is widely communicated and implemented throughout the business, with 91% of MinRes employees completing the training.
column20: Refresher training, Code of Conduct, e-learning package

column6: Confirmed incidents of corruption and actions taken
column13: MinRes' risk management process is supported by ongoing work to embed a centralised online risk management platform into day-to-day decision-making and to refine processes and tools for managing risk. MinRes' risk management platform effectively integrates strategic and operational level reporting, with the software providing both desktop and mobile user accessibility. It improves efficiency and allows for real-time data collection and analysis.
column20: Risk management platform, decision making, operational level reporting

column6: Legal actions for anti-competitive behavior, anti-trust, and monopoly practices
column7: There were no legal actions for anti-competitive behaviour, anti-trust, and monopoly practices during FY23.

column6: Approach to tax
column13: MinRes' tax strategy ensures that MinRes always seeks to comply with the letter and spirit of tax laws. MinRes views tax compliance as an important commitment to contributing to the well-being of society. In complying with the tax laws, the Company supports the nation's public development programs and social support, which play a critical role in supporting the quality of life for the nation's citizens.
column20: Tax strategy, tax law, public development program

column6: Tax governance, control, and risk management
column13: MinRes has a Board-approved Tax Risk Management Framework, which is readily accessible to all employees on the Company's intranet and details the management of tax-related risks across all tax types. While MinRes executives and senior management are responsible for daily tax management, ultimate oversight of the Framework sits with the Audit and Risk Committee.
column20: Tax Risk Management Framework, tax-related risk, tax management

column6: Stakeholder engagement and management of concerns related to tax
column7: MinRes engages with taxation authorities openly and transparently and, where required, seeks guidance from taxation authorities through private rulings or pre-transaction decision requests.

column6: Country-by-country reporting
column7: MinRes' foreign tax resident subsidiaries did not derive any revenue or taxable income for the year.
